org.javascool.proglets.game
Class Functions

java.lang.Object
  org.javascool.proglets.game.Functions
All Implemented Interfaces:
EventCatcher
public class Functions
extends java.lang.Object
implements EventCatcher

Main class for this proglet, it implements EventCatcher to allow it to catch events : is you simply use onClick("exit"); Functions will be used as EventCatcher (but it always return true and catches the event when triggered)

Author:
gmatheron

Nested Class Summary
static class Functions.Clock
          This class allows the proglet to trigger events regularly.

public static boolean classExtends(java.lang.Class<?> sub,

call

private static void call(java.lang.String method,
                         java.lang.Object s)
Calls the specified end-user-defined method, passing as a parameter the specified state. If the function is undefined with one argument, it will be called with no arguments.

Parameters:
method - The end-user-defined method to call
s - The state to pass

call

private static void call(java.lang.String method)
Calls the specified end-user-defined method

Parameters:
method - The end-user-defined method to call

stop

public static void stop()
This method is called after the program finishes running by Clock It stops the timer and deletes the listeners

start

public static void start()
This method is called during init It creates the listeners, the clock and the singleton

callback

private static void callback(java.util.ArrayList<EventListener> functions)
Calls each function of the specified array if the EventCatcher accepts it or is set to always

functions - The functions to call

isForMe

public boolean isForMe()
A function directly assigned to the main panel will always be catched, so return true;

Specified by:
isForMe in interface EventCatcher
Returns:
true
